Package polyglot.frontend

Interface ExtensionInfo

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractExtensionInfo, CovarRetOutputExtensionInfo, ExtensionInfo, ExtensionInfo, JL5ExtensionInfo, JL5OutputExtensionInfo, JL7ExtensionInfo, JL8ExtensionInfo, JLExtensionInfo, JLOutputExtensionInfo, ParserlessJLExtensionInfo
public interface ExtensionInfo
ExtensionInfo is the main interface for defining language extensions. The frontend will load the ExtensionInfo specified on the command-line. It defines the type system, AST node factory, parser, and other parameters of a language extension.

  • Method Details

    • compilerName

      java.lang.String compilerName()
      The name of the compiler for usage messages

    • version

      Version version()
      Report the version of the extension.

    • scheduler

      Scheduler scheduler()
      Returns the pass scheduler.

    • getCompileGoal

      Goal getCompileGoal​(Job job)
      Return the goal for compiling a particular compilation unit. The goal may have subgoals on which it depends.

    • getValidationGoal

      Goal getValidationGoal​(Job job)
      Returns:
      the goal for validating a particular compilation unit.

    • getOptions

      Options getOptions()
      Return an Options object, which will be given the command line to parse.

    • getStats

      Stats getStats()
      Return a Stats object to accumulate and report statistics.

    • initCompiler

      void initCompiler​(Compiler compiler)
      Initialize the extension with a particular compiler. This must be called after the compiler is initialized, but before the compiler starts work.

    • compiler

      Compiler compiler()

    • fileExtensions

      java.lang.String[] fileExtensions()
      Get the file name extension of source files. This is either the language extension's default file name extension or the string passed in with the "-sx" command-line option.

    • defaultFileExtensions

      java.lang.String[] defaultFileExtensions()
      The default extensions that source files are expected to have. Defaults to an array containing defaultFileExtension

    • defaultFileExtension

      java.lang.String defaultFileExtension()
      The default extension that source files are expected to have.

    • typeSystem

      TypeSystem typeSystem()
      Produce a type system for this language extension.

    • nodeFactory

      NodeFactory nodeFactory()
      Produce a node factory for this language extension.

    • sourceLoader

      SourceLoader sourceLoader()
      Get the source file loader for this extension.

    • jobExt

      JobExt jobExt()
      Get the job extension for this language extension. The job extension is used to extend the Job class without subtyping.

    • targetFactory

      TargetFactory targetFactory()
      Produce a target factory for this language extension. The target factory is responsible for naming and opening output files given a package name and a class or source file name.

    • keywords

      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keywords()
      Gets a set of keywords for this language extension.

    • parser

      Parser parser​(java.io.Reader reader, Source source, ErrorQueue eq)
      Get a parser for this language extension.

    • getToExt

      ToExt getToExt​(ExtensionInfo to_ext, Node n)
      Get the ToExt extension object used for translating AST nodes to the to_ext language.

    • extFileManager

      FileManager extFileManager()
      Get the extension file mananger used by this extension.

    • configureFileManagerForPostCompiler

      void configureFileManagerForPostCompiler() throws java.io.IOException
      Configure the filemanger for the post-compilation phase.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • createClassFile

      ClassFile createClassFile​(javax.tools.FileObject f, byte[] code) throws java.io.IOException
      Create class file for a file object.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

      @Deprecated FileSource createFileSource​(javax.tools.FileObject fo, boolean userSpecified) throws java.io.IOException
      Deprecated.
      Use createFileSource(FileObject, Kind) instead.
      Create file source for a file object.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • createFileSource

      FileSource createFileSource​(javax.tools.FileObject fo, Source.Kind kind) throws java.io.IOException
      Create file source for a file object.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • classFileLoader

      ClassFileLoader classFileLoader()
      Produce a class factory for this language extension.

      Produce an extension info object for the output language this extension translates to.

    • cleanup

      void cleanup()
      Delete cached types and source files to reduce memory footprint.

    • defaultLocations

      java.util.List<javax.tools.JavaFileManager.Location> defaultLocations()
      The set of locations to search for packages and class files when otherwise unspecified. This provides some backward compatibility for code written prior to the FileManager API
